workflow.name: Automate CVE detection with AI-powered Nuclei template generation & Google Drive
workflow.description:
## Short description
Automates collection, technical extraction, and automatic generation of Nuclei templates from public CVE PoCs.  
Converts verified PoCs into reproducible detection templates ready for testing and distribution.

## Purpose
Provide a reliable pipeline that turns public proof-of-concept data into usable detection artifacts.  
Reduce manual work involved in finding PoCs, extracting exploit details, validating sources, and building Nuclei templates.

## How it works (technical summary)
1. Runs a scheduled SSH job that executes `vulnx` with filters for recent, high-severity PoCs.  
2. Parses the raw `vulnx` output and splits it into individual CVE entries.  
3. Extracts structured fields: CVE ID, severity, title, summary, risk, remediation, affected products, POCs, and references.  
4. Extracts URLs from PoC sections using regex.  
5. Validates each URL with HTTP requests. Invalid or unreachable links are logged and skipped.  
6. Uses an AI agent (OpenAI via LangChain) to extract technical artifacts: exploit steps, payloads, endpoints, raw HTTP requests/responses, parameters, and reproduction notes. The prompt forces technical-only output.  
7. Sends the extracted technical content to ProjectDiscovery Cloud API to generate Nuclei templates.  
8. Validates AI and API responses. Accepted templates are saved to a configured Google Drive folder.  
9. Produces JSON records and logs for each processed CVE and URL.

## Output
- Nuclei templates in ProjectDiscovery format (YAML) stored in Google Drive.  
- Structured JSON per CVE with metadata and extracted technical details.  
- Validation logs for URL checks, AI extraction, and template generation.

## Intended audience
- Bug bounty hunters.  
- Security researchers and threat intel teams.  
- Automation engineers who need reproducible detection templates.

## Setup & requirements
- n8n instance with workflow imported.  
- SSH access to a host with `vulnx` installed.  
- OpenAI API key for technical extraction.  
- ProjectDiscovery API key for template generation.  
- Google Drive OAuth2 credentials for storing templates.  
- Configure schedule trigger and target Google Drive folder ID.

## Security and usage notes
- Performs static extraction and validation only. No active exploitation.  
- Processes only PoCs that meet configured filters (e.g., CVSS > 6).  
- Use responsibly. Do not target systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.

parameters.content:
# üì¨ Need Help or Want to Customize This?
## **Contact me for consulting and support:** [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/javier-rieiro-2900b5354/) / [Email](mailto:pyus3r@gmail.com)

# ‚öôÔ∏è SET UP

## üß∞ 1. Set Up ProjectDiscovery API
### üîë ProjectDiscovery API
1. Go to [**ProjectDiscovery Cloud Platform**](https://cloud.projectdiscovery.io/).  
2. Log in or create an account.  
3. Open **Settings ‚Üí API Keys**.  
4. Click **Generate New API Key**.  
5. üìã Copy the generated key.  
6. In **n8n**, go to **Credentials ‚Üí New ‚Üí HTTP Request**.  
7. Configure as follows:  
   - **Authentication:** Header Auth  
   - **Name:** `PD-API-Key`  
   - **Value:** *(paste your ProjectDiscovery API key)*  
8. üíæ Save your credentials.  
9. üß™ Test the connection with an HTTP Request node (e.g., `GET https://api.projectdiscovery.io`).
---

## ü§ñ 2. Set Up OpenAI Connection
### üîê Get Your API Key
1. Visit the [üîó OpenAI API Keys](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) page.  
2. Go to [üí≥ OpenAI Billing](https://platform.openai.com/settings/organization/billing/overview).  
3. Add funds to your billing account.  
4. üì• Copy your API key and paste it into your **OpenAI credentials** in n8n (or your chosen platform).  
---

## ‚òÅÔ∏è 3. Set Up Google Drive
- [n8n docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-single-service/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=credential_settings&utm_campaign=create_new_credentials_modal)
---

## üß© 4. Set Up SSH Environment
- [n8n docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/ssh/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=credential_settings&utm_campaign=create_new_credentials_modal)

## Next Steps

- Download Template

- Nuclei (Guide --> https://projectdiscovery.io/blog/ultimate-nuclei-guide)
```
nuclei -u https://example.com -t CVE-2025-34533.yaml
```

## Get CVEs PoC Tips

- Parameters available: `cvss_min`, `max_age`, `include_exploits`
- Use expressions to build the command dynamically
- Filter and send high-severity CVEs to Slack or email
## Generate Nuclei Template with AI Agent & Proyect Discovery API

user.name: Javier Rieiro
user.bio: I‚Äôm Javier Rieiro, a hacker pushing the limits of no-code automation in cybersecurity. Here I show how I use n8n to transform bug bounty and pentesting automating reconnaissance, analysis, and reporting with custom workflows. If you want to see how no code meets offensive security, you‚Äôre in the right place.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
